Detailed Description

Selects among a set of selectables.

Member Enumeration Documentation

enum SelectableSelector::SelectStatus
 

status returned by select

Enumeration values:
TIMEOUT  a timeout occurred
ERROR  something went wrong
OK  everything executed ok

Member Function Documentation

void SelectableSelector::addSelectable (  Selectable *  sel,
bool  readSelect,
bool  writeSelect,
bool  doNotify = true
) 
 

Adds a selectable.

Adds the Selectable to read-select or write-select or both or neighter (but that is a nop). If sel is added to both read- and write-select then it must be removed from both. Mutex method.

Parameters:
sel The Selectable to add.
readSelect If to select for read.
writeSelect If to select for write.

void SelectableSelector::clearAndSet (   )  [private]
 

Clears the fd_sets and add the notify pipe and all in m_readSelectables and m_writeSelectables.

Returns:
The highest selectable.

bool SelectableSelector::empty (   ) 
 

If empty.

Mutex method.

Notify anyone in select.

void SelectableSelector::removeSelectable (  Selectable::selectable  sel,
bool  readSelect,
bool  writeSelect,
bool  doNotify = true
) 
 

Removes a selectable by Selectable::selectable, slow method.

Mutex method.

Parameters:
sel The selectable to remove.
readSelect If to remove from read-select.
writeSelect If to remove from write-select.

void SelectableSelector::removeSelectable (  Selectable *  sel,
bool  readSelect,
bool  writeSelect,
bool  doNotify = true
) 
 

Removes a selectable by pointer.

Mutex method.

Parameters:
sel The Selectable to remove.
readSelect If to remove from read-select.
writeSelect If to remove from write-select.

SelectStatus SelectableSelector::select (  int32  timeout,
selSet &  readReady,
selSet &  writeReady
) 
 

Select among the selectables with a timeout.

Mutex method at beginning and end of method but not when actually selecting.

Parameters:
timeout Timeout for select in microseconds, waits forever if negative.
readReady Selectables ready for read are added to this.
writeReady Selectables ready for write are added to this.
Returns:
0 on select ok, -1 on error and -2 on timeout.

void SelectableSelector::terminate (   ) 
 

Set to terminate, select returns immediately.

Calls notify.
